One my favorite games of all time

[h1]ANO DE 1912[/h1]

Uma cidade que voa pelos cÃ©us e que Ã© dominada por uma forte comunidade religiosa. O profeta Comstock Ã© quem reina em Columbia, e Ã© adorado como um deus.

Estamos na pele de Booker DeWitt, um antigo soldado que tambÃ©m trabalhou como um agente. Booker foi enviado para a cidade para resgatar Elizabeth, sendo esta a Ãºnica forma de se livrar de uma dÃ­vida. Ela Ã© considerada perigosa, por isso Ã© mantida trancada em uma torre atÃ© que esse dia chegue.

Elizabeth pode abrir Fendas, rasgos para outra realidade e criar versÃµes alternativas do mundo. Apesar de nÃ£o pegar numa arma ou atacar, Ela ajuda durante os combates fornecendo muniÃ§Ãµes, saÃºde e Sais (Sais sÃ£o equivalentes ao EVE dos Bioshock's anteriores) alÃ©m de abrir pequenas fendas que fornecem acesso a pontos importantes, como torretas, proteÃ§Ãµes e ganchos.  [i]''Um ponto importante para destacar Ã© que, ao contrÃ¡rio da grande maioria dos companheiros de IA ao longo dos tempos, Elizabeth nÃ£o precisa de babÃ¡. Pelo contrÃ¡rio, ela cuidarÃ¡ de vocÃª, jogando muniÃ§Ã£o e saÃºde no meio da batalha''[/i]


[h1]COMBATE[/h1]
O combate de Bioshock continua fantÃ¡stico, temos metralhadoras, rifles, espingardas, lanÃ§a mÃ­sseis (e granadas), etc. Tudo isto pode ser melhorado com pentes de muniÃ§Ã£o maiores, dano extra, carregamentos mais rÃ¡pidos e outras caracterÃ­sticas.

Assim como todo Bioshock temos os plasmids... Bolas de fogo, relÃ¢mpagos, pequenos ciclones, etc. Tudo que gostamos em Bioshock, agora com grandes combinaÃ§Ãµes. As interaÃ§Ãµes dos plasmids com o cenÃ¡rio continua, ou seja, podemos elÃªtrocutar uma poÃ§a de Ã¡gua, atear fogo em uma poÃ§a de Ã³leo, etc.

O combate Ã© Ã¡gil no verdadeiro sentido da palavra, graÃ§as Ã  sua outra grande evoluÃ§Ã£o: Skylines. Ao mesmo tempo, o ritmo Ã© quase perfeito. A aÃ§Ã£o frenÃ©tica Ã© equilibrada com sequÃªncias mais calmas, onde o jogo permite que os jogadores visitem Ã¡reas povoadas sem grandes incÃ³modos (a nÃ£o ser que roubem alguÃ©m ou ataquem um guarda). Existe muito para ver e descobrir.


[h1]GRÃFICO E SOM[/h1]
Columbia Ã© um local memorÃ¡vel e tem um ambiente estupendo. A iluminaÃ§Ã£o Ã© impressionante, desde os raios de sol que passam pelas nuvens, as velas da catedral criam um efeito magnÃ­fico no interior, a fumaÃ§a e o fogo que se vislumbra no horizonte Ã© um espetÃ¡culo. As grandes vistas panorÃ¢micas de estÃ¡tuas, os espaÃ§os abertos, os dirigÃ­veis e os bairros, tudo com pequenos detalhes, como as decoraÃ§Ãµes das lojas e as propagandas, tudo foi muito bem produzido.

A atmosfera Ã© acentuada com uma trilha sonora excelente. As interpretaÃ§Ãµes dos atores impressionam, seja ao ouvir a conversa de um casal ou uma discussÃ£o marcante na histÃ³ria.

Bioshock Infinite Ã© o terceiro jogo da serie Bioshock, muitos dizem que serÃ¡ o ultimo. Mas infinite nÃ£o encera um arco... ele abra infinitos arcos... afinal, [i]''Sempre hÃ¡ um farol, um homem, uma cidade''[/i]

I didn't play the first two, but the campaign on this game felt pretty short and I ended up confused as hell lol. I can't recommend it because it was underwhelming to me, but I won't strongly recommend against it either because I don't typically play or enjoy light RPG FPS games.

I want to like this game, I really do. It has so many issues though that are just pulling it down for me.
This includes but it not limited to:
-Two weapon limit
-very scarce ammunition (at least on higher difficulties)
-bland firefights
-broken keybinds on "Burial at Sea" DLC
-not being called Daddy like in Bioshock 2

Bioshock 1 probably had the best story of the three, Bioshock 2 the best overall gameplay. Biochock Infinite though? I guess graphics, maybe (?)

Give it a try to see that it's painfully mediocre and could've been so much better.
Desde mi punto de vista en esta realidad es uno de los mejores juegos, aunque no sÃ© si es una constante o una variable.
One of the best story games ever

Over the years I have seen poor reviews of this game up to and including that the story was awful and game play leaves much to be desired. Well.... I agree the game and gun play could have been better in ways, I wish they had stuck with the original Bioshock format on the combat. That being said, the story is EPIC and blows away most of the other game story lines I have played through. Whoever says this story is bad simply didn't get it or are not fans of stuff that might make you think a little bit. Basically, they are basic bitches. I can confidently say that. Allow me to explain. 

I first played this game on the Xbox when it released as I was a long time Bioshock fan. I beat the game and understood the core concept which alone is great but it still left so much I didn't know/understand. So... I played it again. This time I paid close attention and gathered all the audio logs. Took about a week on and off piecing things together and writing down the timeline and it split my brain wide open. I wont tell you anything on that other than this. 

The twins, although not critical to the gameplay whatsoever, are extremely important figures in the story. PAY CLOSE ATTENTION to them and find the logs. Seriously you will not regret it at all if you manage to pull it off. 

Overall I give this game a 8/10. The only things I would say it lacks is as I said, slightly better combat and maybe a prequel DLC. Otherwise, it's a masterpiece for the time it was made and will remain highly poised as one of the best video game stories I have ever experienced.
Unpopular opinion: Infinite is the best one in the trilogy
When most games of the first twenty years of the new millenium are forgotten, people will still talk about this one.
Very good game with many twists and turns I 100% insist you play this game.

This game has a lot of ideas that work, and a lot of ideas that don't. If you're new to the Bioshock series, don't play this game first, if you've already played the previous games, I think it's worth getting, but there's a high chance you may not like it.

Let's start with everything bad, first of all, for most of the game the Lutece twins feel like a plot tool, they are there just to drive the plot forward and even tho it is explained why and how they just appear out of nowhere and do what they do it still isn't great. The enemies and the areas are far less memorable, the only thing that will make you remember an area will be some event you either really liked or hated. For a decent chunk of the game you are just going back and forth from one area to another and even three times in the exact same place just to get to your goal, this ended up being boring and even tho some very interesting things happened with the plot in this time it did not save it. The enemies lost their unique character and the game doesn't have the hard ethical question that made the previous two games what they are. The Handymen are a cheap replacement for the big daddies but they are far far worse. If they hit you your whole screen is usually taken over by their body so you don't even know what is going on. The few choices that you have in the game don't actually make any difference and there also a God awful boss fight against the First Lady, she is a bullet spunge and one of the most unfun bosses I've ever fought. The ending of the game is somewhat familiar to BioShock 2 in the way that is a repetitive fight against lots of enemies with the difference being that in BioShock 2 it was actually interesting cause of Eleanor and Sinclair. The death of the songbird also felt cheap cause: 1. Elizabeth did not need to take it with us through the tear, 2. I felt nothing about the bird, 3. The fact that it got angry just cause the thing we used to "control" fell out of our hand feels stupid. Very minor thing that could be better: I would have liked it if Elizabeth had slightly different dialogue as the way she sees Booker changes through the story and it would also be nice if she reacted when you upgraded your Vigors and weapons like the Little Sisters in BioShock 2. Also it would be nice IF I COULD HAVE MORE THAN TWO GODDAMN WEAPONS. (it's technically one cause let's be honest the shotgun will take one of those slots).
I liked the game quite a bit... Elizabeth was a really good character and the story, even if it was too convoluted for its own good, was really good even tho the worldbuilding and combat did let me down and there were no interesting side characters. Even tho I would suggest it (not the DLC, please for the love of God don't buy that) I wouldn't give it more than 7.5/10

7/10
While the game play feels like it has been taken from 50 other games, the chick is hot.

Gameplay is massively downgraded in comparison to both of the previous titles. The story while mildly interesting only really intrigued me towards the end. Combat is boring and poorly done, boss fights if you can even call them that are also awful as you can cheese some boss battles with a vendor/store that sells health and ammo. Which brings me to the next problem, ammo is incredibly scarce, you'll constantly be running out and you can only carry two weapons at a time. This wouldn't be a problem if the game was super fast paced and you could always find a weapon, but during the cemetery fight you'll almost certainly run out of ammo and the only way to progress is to die for ammunition as there are no weapons or no ammunition within the enclosed fight. 

At least Elizabeth rule 34 is pretty decent, that's the only real positive I can think of when it comes to this title. You're not missing out if you don't purchase this game.
